text: The Evening Standard, formerly The Standard (1827â€“1904), also known as the London Evening Standard, is a local free daily newspaper in London, England, published Monday to Friday in tabloid format. In October 2009, after being purchased by Russian businessman Alexander Lebedev, the paper ended a 180-year history of paid circulation and became a free newspaper. They doubling its circulation as part of a change in its business plan. ==References== Category:Newspapers published in the United Kingdom Category:English-language newspapers
title: Evening Standard
